statement.title: # Content
statement.content:
Calculate 

$$\Sigma gcd(i, j)^K$$ 

$$where\ 1\leq i,j\leq N$$

In mathematics, the greatest common divisor (GCD), 
also known as the greatest common factor (GCF), 
is the largest positive integer that divides the numbers without a remainder. 
For example, the GCD of $8$ and $12$ is $4$.

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content: The input contains two integers $N$, $K$, $(1\leq N\leq 10^{10}, 1\leq K\leq 5)$,

statement.title: # Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
2 27
